business.headline: Sensex rebounds over 800 points from day's low: 4 things investors need to knowThe recovery capped one of the most volatile trading days in recent weeks and came after intense selling pressure had pushed markets into oversold territory during the morning.

Income tax return filing: Know the cost of missing the July 31 ITR deadlineFiling your income tax return after July 31 can cost more than you expect. From late fees and interest to delayed refunds and lost tax benefits, missing the ITR deadline makes compliance more expensive and restrictive for taxpayers.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Latest GMP, subscription status and what it signalsFor now, the subscription data and GMP suggest that the Bharat Coking Coal IPO remains one of the most closely watched offerings, with sentiment clearly tilted towards a strong debut.

Budget 2026: Why smarter tax slabs matter more than big cutsAs nominal incomes rise, taxpayers drift into higher brackets without any improvement in real purchasing power. This bracket creep amounts to a quiet tightening of tax burden, dampening consumption without any explicit policy decision.

Sensex down nearly 3,000 points in 6 days: What's really driving the sell-offThe past six days have been a reminder that markets do not move in straight lines. When uncertainty rises and confidence weakens, even strong long-term stories can go through uncomfortable phases.

How employers can address New labour code's take-home salary and build employee trustFor employers, the reform means more disciplined salary design and tighter governance. Compensation structures that previously leaned heavily on allowances now require rebalancing. Finance leaders will need to review salary templates, update payroll logic, and ensure CTCs align with the wage definition.

Sensex tumbles over 600 points: 3 reasons why the stock market is fallingAt around 11:48 am, the Sensex was trading at 82,937.81, down 638.43 points, while the Nifty stood at 25,494.30, lower by 189 points.

Gold, silver prices at record levels: What should investors expect next?With prices at record highs, the real question for investors is not what gold and silver have done, but whether this rally is merely pausing or setting up for another leg higher.

Explained: Why HDFC Bank shares remain under selling pressureAs of 10:24 am, shares of the private lender were trading at Rs 932.80, down Rs 6.20, or 0.66 per cent, adding to losses seen over recent sessions.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO day 2: Check GMP, key dates and should you invest?For investors, the Bharat Coking Coal IPO appears to be a play on listing gains and medium-term stability rather than a deep long-term value bet at current valuations.

Gold, silver prices near record highs: Should you buy now or wait?In India, gold prices remain firm while silver continues to see sharper ups and downs. These levels have made buyers cautious, especially those looking at jewellery purchases or small investments rather than short-term trading.

Sensex, Nifty fall for 6th straight day as D-Street's turbulent run continuesAt around 9:21 am, the Sensex was trading at 83,252.86, down 323.38 points, or 0.39 per cent, while the Nifty stood at 25,592.60, lower by 90.70 points. Losses were broad-based, reflecting rising investor caution amid persistent domestic concerns and unsettled global cues.

Income tax refund delays: Why many taxpayers are still waitingComplaints over refunds stuck at the "processing" stage have been trending across social media platforms and grievance portals, bringing renewed attention to the pace of return processing.

PM pitches Gujarat as investment hub; Adani Group, Reliance unveil big-ticket betsPM Modi said that India's growth story is being powered by an expanding middle class and rising purchasing power, alongside structural reforms.

Budget 2026: Will old tax regime survive and should new regime get deductions?Over the past few years, the government has steadily pushed the new tax regime as the default option while keeping the old regime alive for those with existing commitments and deductions.

Drowning in debt: How easy loans are turning into an EMI nightmare for IndiansMonth after month, salaries go to EMIs, essentials shrink, and families realise that what once felt temporary has become the new normal. Read on to understand how this silent debt crisis is unfolding within Indian households.

SIP investments hit record high in December 2025: AMFIThe latest data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) for December 2025 shows steady participation from retail investors, record SIP contributions and sustained interest in equity and hybrid schemes.
Is it possible for the US to put a price tag on Greenland?In 1946, the US offered to buy the vast, mineral-rich Arctic island from Denmark for $100 million, an offer that was rejected back then.

Will your PF keep earning interest after you have left job?Changing jobs is common today, but doubts around Provident Fund savings still linger. Many employees worry that their PF stops growing once they leave a job. The truth, however, is very different and often misunderstood.

Tax relief on the cards? What to expect from Budget 2026Changes to tax slabs, a higher exemption limit and a continued push towards the new tax regime helped reduce the tax burden for many families and eased pressure on households in budget 2025.

entertainment.headline: Leonardo DiCaprio's viral K-Pop comment during Globes break sparks buzz Leonardo DiCaprio's night at the 2026 Golden Globes saw him engaging with K-pop references and receiving light-hearted jokes from host Nikki Glaser, while his film One Battle After Another secured multiple nominations.

Exclusive: All about Farah Khan-hosted new reality show The 50 Farah Khan hosts The 50, a reality show with 50 celebrity contestants competing in entertaining tasks. Fans can vote and potentially win a share of the prize money, changing the non-fiction TV landscape in India.

K-pop Exclusive: IDID wins the 'aegyo' battle, Push Back, love for tandoori chicken, India In this India Today interview with Bhavna Agarwal, members of the K-pop group IDID discuss their journey from trainees to debuting as a group under Starship Entertainment.

The Raja Saab box office Day 3: Lowest first Sunday for Prabhas in 4 years Prabhas's The Raja Saab earned Rs 19.1 crore on its first Sunday, marking the actor's lowest Sunday opening in four years. The horror-comedy has seen a steady drop amid negative reviews.

Malavika Mohanan talks about turning down Hindi films after Beyond the Clouds Malavika Mohanan opened up about being selective with her Bollywood projects after Beyond the Clouds, saying her choices are driven by creative instinct rather than industry size.

Hans Zimmer on Golden Globes snub: You don't have a movie without composers Hans Zimmer voiced his disappointment following the Golden Globes' decision to exclude the Best Original Score award from its televised ceremony. The composer said that he wouldn't talk to the person who came up with the last-minute decision.

Owen Cooper, 16, becomes youngest Golden Globe Supporting Actor winner At just 16, Owen Cooper has smashed a Golden Globe record, becoming the youngest Supporting Actor winner in TV history. His breakout role in Netflix's Adolescence has officially made him the industry's new young star.

Naveen Kaushik shares BTS moments from Dhurandhar's climax fight scene Naveen Kaushik won praise for his role as Donga in Aditya Dhar's blockbuster spy thriller Dhurandhar and recently shared fun behind-the-scenes moments from the film's climactic action sequence.

Did we stop Jana Nayagan? Parasakthi actor slams Vijay fans over negative reviews Actor and producer Dev Ramnath raises concerns over coordinated negative reviews and online campaigns targeting the film Parasakthi, following its release ahead of Pongal.

83rd Golden Globes: Leonardo DiCaprio, Owen Cooper's photo-op steals the show Owen Cooper made history at the 83rd Golden Globes by becoming the youngest recipient of the Best Supporting Actor award for a TV series, as he posed with Leonardo DiCaprio at the ceremony and delivered a heartfelt acceptance speech.

Jana Nayagan: Makers of Vijay's film approach Supreme Court in censor row Producers of Vijay's Jana Nayagan have approached the Supreme Court against the Madras High Court's stay on a CBFC certification order.

You can't put everything on a star: Chitrangda Singh on why Dhurandhar works Actor Chitrangda Singh praised the film Dhurandhar for its strong screenplay and writing. She said the film is a wake-up call, urging the industry to value writers more deeply.

Inside Golden Globes 2026 gift bag: Luxury travels, wellness products, Om potli The 83rd Annual Golden Globes introduced its largest and most valuable luxury gift bag yet, including exclusive resort stays, beauty and wellness products, and ultra-rare French wine. It was valued at nearly $1 million.

Why was Snoop Dogg's speech briefly censored at 83rd Golden Globes? Read here Snoop Dogg was censored while presenting the Best Podcast award at the 2026 Golden Globes, sparking curiosity among viewers about his remarks before Amy Poehler's win for Good Hang.

Celebrities wear Be Good pins at Golden Globes 2026. Here's what it means At the 83rd Golden Globe Awards, celebrities such as Mark Ruffalo and Wanda Sykes wore 'Be Good' pins on the red carpet. Read on to know what it means.

Anushka Sharma marks daughter Vamika's birthday: Wouldn't go back to old self Anushka Sharma marked her daughter Vamika's fifth birthday on January 11 by sharing reflections on how motherhood has changed her life. The actor expressed that she would not trade her current self for anything.

Gloden Globes 2026: Nikki Glaser mocks Leonardo DiCaprio's dating life Comedian Nikki Glaser hosted the 2026 Golden Globe Awards for a second consecutive year, using her opening monologue to deliver pointed jokes at celebrities including Leonardo DiCaprio and referencing recent industry controversies.

Adolescence dominates Golden Globes 2026 with four major wins Psychological crime drama Adolescence emerged as a major winner at the Golden Globes 2026, taking home four awards including Best Limited Series and acting honours for Stephen Graham, Owen Cooper and Erin Doherty.

30 years, no master plan: Rani Mukerji reflects on cinema, courage and Mardaani 3 Rani Mukerji marks 30 years in Hindi cinema with a heartfelt note reflecting on an instinct-driven career shaped by honesty, vulnerability and resilience. She also shares why Mardaani 3 feels like a meaningful milestone in her journey today.

general news.headline: Isro's PSLV loses control after thundering launch, 16 satellites lost in spaceThe 260-tonne PSLV-DL variant thundered skyward at 10.17 am, performing nominally through the first two stages and separation, captivating viewers nationwide.

Donald Trump declares himself acting president of VenezuelaDonald Trump's surprising claim emerged weeks after the US carried out a so-called "large-scale" military strike in Venezuela, capturing President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores and bringing them to New York.

UAE warns of Islamic radicalisation on UK campuses, ends students' scholarshipsThe United Arab Emirates has decided to end funding for Emirati students studying in UK-based universities due to fears they might get radicalised by Islamic terrorist group Muslim Brotherhood in British educational institutions. Ties between the UK and the UAE have become strained over multiple issues.

Isro PSLV-C62 mission fails to deliver: What went wrong in space?India's first space mission of 2026 ended in heartbreak as the PSLV-C62 rocket suffered a critical third stage anomaly. Strategic satellites including DRDO's Anvesha are feared lost after the vehicle deviated from its path.

Sorry, Kolkata. Bikaner is India's undisputed mithai capitalWhile Kolkata remains famous for its traditional chhena sweets, Bikaner has built a diverse and enduring sweet empire that caters to global tastes. This desert city's innovative approach to sweets and snacks is redefining India's culinary landscape.

Bengaluru techie didn't die in fire, was strangled by teen neighbour: CopsPolice have found that Sharmila was strangled to death inside her Bengaluru apartment, after which the accused set the flat on fire to destroy evidence.

All eyes on Priyanka Chopra as she brings blue glam to the Golden Globes in DiorPriyanka Chopra Jonas wore a custom blue Dior gown featuring an intriguing mix of metallic and matte details at the 2026 Golden Globe Awards.

I'll kick you: Raj Thackeray warns UP, Bihar migrants against Hindi impositionRaj Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray have joined forces to safeguard Marathi pride in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections. Their rally highlights concerns over Hindi imposition and BJP's influence in Mumbai's political and economic landscape.

83rd Golden Globes: Leonardo DiCaprio, Owen Cooper's photo-op steals the showOwen Cooper made history at the 83rd Golden Globes by becoming the youngest recipient of the Best Supporting Actor award for a TV series, as he posed with Leonardo DiCaprio at the ceremony and delivered a heartfelt acceptance speech.

Raghav Chadha turns Blinkit delivery rider for a day, shares 'stay tuned' teaserIn a short teaser posted on his X account, Raghav Chadha is seen changing into a Blinkit T-shirt and jacket before taking a delivery bag from a rider.

Season's coldest: North India freezes as Delhi hits 3.2°C, frost blankets plainsDelhi and several northern states are experiencing the coldest temperatures of the season, prompting cold wave alerts and school closures. The India Meteorological Department warns that severe cold and dense fog will continue to impact the region over the coming days.

Ahead of India launch, Starlink gets nod to launch 7,500 more satellites into orbitElon Musk's SpaceX is set to launch Starlink in India soon. Ahead of this launch, SpaceX has received the approval of the US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to launch 7,500 more satellites to boost the satellite internet network.

Watch: PM, German Chancellor fly kites together at grand Ahmedabad festivalPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday joined German Chancellor Friedrich Merz at the International Kite Festival 2026 at the Sabarmati Riverfront in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. Both the leaders were seen flying huge tricolour kites. Merz is on his first official visit to India, as New Delhi and Berlin look to step up cooperation across strategic, economic and security sectors. The trip followed their PM Modi's meeting with Merz on the sidelines of the G7 Summit, where both leaders agreed to widen the bilateral strategic partnership, with the Prime Minister extending a formal invitation for the visit.

Crocodile tears for Iran, but silent on Gaza: Tehran slams US amid deadly protests Live UpdatesA US-based rights group claimed that 490 protesters and 48 security personnel were killed, with more than 10,600 arrests recorded nationwide since demonstrations erupted in Iran last month.

Man flaunts Thar's 'benefits' while driving on wrong side, video sparks outrageIn the now-viral video, titled "Benefits of Thar", the man is seen driving his Thar against traffic on a highway and claiming that the biggest advantage of owning the vehicle is the freedom to flout traffic rules without consequences.

New Tata Punch to launch tomorrow: All you need to knowTata Motors will launch the refreshed Tata Punch tomorrow, bringing major updates in design, features and performance. The 2026 facelift adds a turbo-petrol engine, sharper styling and upgraded tech.

What went wrong at Karur rally? CBI to question Vijay on delays, safety lapsesActor Vijay is set to appear before the CBI in Delhi for questioning regarding the deadly stampede at a Tamil Nadu political rally. The investigation aims to uncover lapses in crowd control and safety measures that led to 41 fatalities.

Unburdened, unlocked: Virat Kohli reinvents his ODI game in fearless final actIndia vs New Zealand: No longer weighed down by milestones or expectation, Virat Kohli now bats on instinct and intent. Since returning to ODI action last October, he has scored at a strike rate of 103, significantly higher than his career strike rate.

Is this Jennifer Lawrence's boldest look yet? A naked dress at Golden GlobesJennifer Lawrence made an appearance at the Golden Globes in a sheer, barely there gown which seems to have grabbed a lot of attention.

Flying solo? Why Neeraj split with Zelezny and what's next for javelin starNeeraj Chopra has ended his coaching partnership with Jan Železný after just one year. He has launched the Vel foundation to back emerging athletes and take charge of his training and legacy.

Jana Nayagan: Makers of Vijay's film approach Supreme Court in censor rowProducers of Vijay's Jana Nayagan have approached the Supreme Court against the Madras High Court's stay on a CBFC certification order.

TMC supporters tried to hijack court proceedings: ED's big charge over I-PAC raidsThe ED has filed fresh pleas in the Supreme Court over the raids linked to I-PAC in Kolkata, alleging that the West Bengal government obstructed its duty and that TMC supporters tried to hijack the Calcutta High Court hearing last week.

sports.headline: Ayush Badoni gets maiden ODI call-up, replaces injured Washington Sundar Indian selectors have named uncapped youngster Ayush Badoni as the replacement for all-rounder Washington Sundar, who has been ruled out of the ODI series against New Zealand after suffering a rib injury in the series opener in Vadodara.

Harshit Rana's mantra to cut out noise: Rahane reveals how pacer battles trolls Ajinkya Rahane revealed how Harshit Rana battled social media trolling during a difficult IPL phase. The KKR captain said the pacer cut out the noise and responded with decisive all-round performances for India.

Nabi, Eisakhil become first father-son duo to bat together in top-tier T20 league Hassan Eisakhil played a memorable knock for Noakhali Express in the Bangladesh Premier League, batting alongside his father Mohammad Nabi to become the first father-son pair to share the crease in a top-tier T20 league.

Virat Kohli is on a different level, you can't contain greats like him: Kyle Jamieson New Zealand all-rounder Kyle Jamieson admitted he could only stand back in admiration of Virat Kohli's mastery, saying the Indian great operates on a different level, one where elite batters inevitably find a way to dominate, no matter how hard bowlers try to rein them in.

Carrick emerges as favourite for Manchester United interim manager job: Report Manchester United have intensified their search for an interim manager following meetings with Michael Carrick and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer. Reports suggest Carrick has emerged as the leading candidate, with further discussions planned to finalise the appointment ahead of the Manchester derby.

Flying solo? Why Neeraj split with Zelezny and what's next for javelin star Neeraj Chopra has ended his coaching partnership with Jan Železný after just one year. He has launched the Vel foundation to back emerging athletes and take charge of his training and legacy.

Watch: Mbappe pulls away Real Madrid teammates, refuses guard of honour for Barcelona Kylian Mbappe sparked controversy after appearing to pull Real Madrid teammates away from offering Barcelona a guard of honour. The incident followed Madrid's 3-2 defeat in the Spanish Super Cup final in Saudi Arabia.

WPL 2026: Fresh from MI escape, RCB face tough questions against UP Warriorz WPL 2026, Gujarat Giants Women vs UP Warriorz Women Match Today: RCB will look to carry forward their winning momentum when they take on Meg Lanning's Warriorz, who will be eager to bounce back after their defeat to the Gujarat Giants.

Harshit Rana opens up on India grooming him as an all-rounder, eyes ODI No.7 role IND vs NZ: Harshit Rana revealed India are grooming him as an all-rounder in the ODI setup. The pacer said he is confident of contributing 30–40 runs down the order after his impactful outing against New Zealand.

No room for trophies at Virat Kohli's home? They stay at his mom's Gurugram placeVirat Kohli combined a match-winning 93 with a touching revelation off the field, saying he sends every award from his international career to his mother's Gurugram home. The Indian great guided India to a nervy four-wicket win over New Zealand in the first ODI.

Hacker hits Bruno: Man United react after rogue X posts on INEOS, Bonnie BlueA series of erratic posts appeared on Bruno Fernandes's X account late on Sunday before being deleted. Manchester United later confirmed the account had been hacked, urged supporters not to engage with the content.

Raphinha repays Hansi Flick's faith with Super Cup final brace vs Real MadridRaphinha repaid Hansi Flick's faith with a match-winning brace as Barcelona edged Real Madrid 3-2 to claim the Spanish Super Cup. His goals proved decisive in a dramatic final marked by late pressure, a red card and relentless Madrid attacks.

Unburdened, unlocked: Virat Kohli reinvents his ODI game in fearless final actIndia vs New Zealand: No longer weighed down by milestones or expectation, Virat Kohli now bats on instinct and intent. Since returning to ODI action last October, he has scored at a strike rate of 103, significantly higher than his career strike rate.

KL Rahul and perks of batting at No.6: India star explains advantage of roleKL Rahul explained the perks and pressure that comes with batting for at No.6 and playing the finisher's role for the side. Rahul helped India beat New Zealand in the Baroda ODI.

Jemimah dejected after DC lose thriller vs Gujarat: Tough pill to swallowJemimah Rodrigues was dejected after the Delhi Capitals lost back-to-back games following their four-run defeat to the Gujarat Giants on Sunday in Navi Mumbai.

Happens to MS Dhoni too: Virat Kohli reveals a unique problem because of fans' crazeVirat Kohli opened up on the fan craze for him during the Baroda ODI against New Zealand on Sunday, January 11 and compared to the situation to the one MS Dhoni faces during CSK matches in the IPL.

Sophie Devine's 95, last over heroics hand Delhi Capitals back-to-back defeatsWPL 2026, DC vs GG: Delhi Capitals slumped to back-to-back defeats in the tournament after the Gujarat Giants beat them by four runs on Sunday in Navi Mumbai.

IND vs NZ: After Rishabh Pant, India lose Washington Sundar for New Zealand ODIsFollowing the injury of Rishabh Pant, India was dealt with another blow as Washington Sundar was ruled out of the remainder of the New Zealand series due to a side strain.

India vs New Zealand 1st ODI: Kohli's 93, Dropped Catches & Rahul Seal Tense Win | IND-NZ ODIIn a special report, India Today's Consulting Editor, Nikhil Naz, breaks down India's tense four-wicket victory over New Zealand in the first ODI at Baroda. Naz points out that while India appeared to be cruising towards an easy win, the match became a '50-50 sort of an encounter' following the dismissal of Virat Kohli for 93. He states, 'While he was there on the crease, it looked like India are in cruise control, driver's seat, cruising to an easy win.' Naz also highlights that dropped catches by an otherwise proficient New Zealand side proved critical. He notes that the visiting team was not at full strength, with several key players missing, yet they still managed to give India a tough fight before KL Rahul finished the match.

IND vs NZ: India survive scare in 301 chase after Virat Kohli's rare 90s blunderIndia survived an almighty scare from New Zealand in Baroda as Virat Kohli's 93 was enough to seal the win and take a 1-0 lead in the series. Harshit's all-round performance and KL Rahul's calmness came in clutch for the hosts as Kyle Jamieson's four-wicket haul got the Blackcaps interested in the game.

Who is Nandini Sharma? Delhi Capitals bowler scripts history with WPL hat-trickWPL 2026, DC v GG: Nandini Sharma became the first Delhi Capitals' bowler to take a hat-trick in the history of the tournament. She finished with figures of 4-0-33-5 after dismissing Kanika Ahuja, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, and Renuka Singh in the last over.

Sophie Devine struck by 90s curse again, falls short of historic WPL hundredWPL 2026, DC vs GG: Sophie Devine fell short of a Women's Premier League century again, scoring 95 off 42 balls against Delhi Capitals before succumbing to the 90s curse.

Sanjay Bangar calls Hindi national language during commentary, gets reality checkIND vs NZ, 1st ODI: Sanjay Bangar sparked backlash after saying he preferred the "national language" during commentary, with many pointing out that the Constitution recognises 22 languages and India has no national language.

Liverpool's Bradley set to be out for the season after knee injury vs ArsenalConor Bradley will undergo surgery and faces an uncertain timeline for return after suffering a knee injury during Liverpool's 0-0 Premier League draw with Arsenal. The defender was stretchered off following an off-the-ball incident in stoppage time, with media reports indicating the injury could be season-ending.

New year, same Virat Kohli: Indian great reaches new milestone, just behind TendulkarVirat Kohli started 2026 in impressive fashion as he became the second-highest run-getter in international cricket during the first ODI between India and New Zealand in Baroda on Sunday, January 11.

Ole back at the wheel? Can Solksjaer really rescue Manchester United?Ole Gunnar Solksjaer is edging close to a return to Manchester United as their interim manager till the end of the season. While he did some magic as the temporary boss in his first stint, can he do the same at United yet again?

DC vs GG Highlights: Capitals slump to back-to-back losses as Giants win thrillerDelhi Capitals Women (DC) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GG) Highlights: Laura Wolvaardt scored 77 runs, but her efforts went in vain as the Delhi Capitals lost to the Gujarat Giants by four runs in Navi Mumbai.

Bangladesh umpire officiates in India while team cites security fears for T20 World CupBangladesh umpire Sharfuddoula Saikat is officiating in the ongoing India-New Zealand ODI series despite Bangladesh's security concerns about India. This situation raises questions over the BCB's stance amid IPL controversies and government actions.

An Se Young carries red-hot form into New Year, wins Malaysia Open South Korea's An Se-young secured her third consecutive Malaysia Open women's singles title. After finishing 2025 with four titles in a row, the reigning Olympic champion picked up where she left off last year. An will now look to defend her India Open crown in New Delhi later this week.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
